roleset.name: an upside-down smile
roleset.note: FROWN-V NOTES: could conceivably take a cognate object: 'frown a worried frown' (from frown.01-v)

example.name: bare participle
example.text: She-1 stood *trace*-1 frowning and chewing her lip.

roleset.name: disapprove of
roleset.note: FROWN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'frown' based on sentences in brown. Verbnet entry (from frown.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: for shame!
example.text: It is like medical schools in India where, in that fairy-land of religious inhibition, [the dissection of dead bodies]-1 is frowned upon *trace*-1.

example.name: both args
example.text: When cattle became more valuable, ranch owners frowned upon this practice and it was discontinued.
